body_html:
@bhack If tf.layers would be removed later, what should I use in the future? Is there any Tensorflow based middle level package like slim but supported officially by Google in later versions?

I really do not like keras, because I cannot flexibly define my own tensorboard data, such as personalized middle results, selected losses or only part of the variables' statistics. I just want to use Tensorflow only. Thank you.
body_text:
@bhack If tf.layers would be removed later, what should I use in the future? Is there any Tensorflow based middle level package like slim but supported officially by Google in later versions?
I really do not like keras, because I cannot flexibly define my own tensorboard data, such as personalized middle results, selected losses or only part of the variables' statistics. I just want to use Tensorflow only. Thank you.
body:
@bhack If tf.layers would be removed later, what should I use in the future? Is there any Tensorflow based middle level package like slim but supported officially by Google in later versions?

I really do not like keras, because I cannot flexibly define my own tensorboard data, such as personalized middle results, selected losses or only part of the variables' statistics. I just want to use Tensorflow only. Thank you.
